reviews.text: I travel to a lot of hotels around the world on business trips, and I had a pretty bad experience at the Welcome Hotel in Paderborn. Just like another reviewer, when I arrived late at the hotel (about 11pm), they informed me that there had been "a mistake" and they had no room for me. This was despite me having pre-paid the 120 euros for the night!
reviews.title: Not a good experience

reviews.text: They arranged for a taxi to take me to another hotel in Paderborn (which turned out to be OK), but the inconvenience after a long day of travel (and the fact that they really don't seem to care whether you've booked in advance or not - they have no qualms about giving away your room) were a horrible start to my time in Germany. The next day I was finally given a room, and after I asked for some kind of compensation, was brought up a small tray of fruit. Not exactly a great deal there!
reviews.title: Good place to sleep

reviews.text: Apart from that, it might be the Euro standard (outside of the UK), but the room was pretty small, the mattress very saggy (again, highlighted by other reviews too), and the double bed was actually two single beds pushed together (and as I was staying on my own, it had one pillow and one single-bed sized quilt!)
reviews.title: Unseen & unknown heroes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very hot during my stay, and the air conditioning wasn't great - it was, well... room temperature, and there was no way for me to set it any lower - I suspect the temperature is centrally managed. It wasn't pleasant to walk into my room after the hot day and find it was only slightly cooler inside!
reviews.title: Good hotel, restaurant average

reviews.text: So on the whole: small rooms, uncomfortable mattresses, and a hotel that has no qualms in giving someone else your room even if you've paid in advance. Oh, and the towels are really rough (they're obviously old and heavily washed). Not worth the money, and nowhere near a "proper" 4 star standard (as you'd expect in the USA/UK).
reviews.title: Always a pleasure staying here
